intro: Cienfuegosia hakeifolia var. lilacina, commonly known as the lilac-flowered cienfuegosia, is a flowering plant native to the subtropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, lilac-colored bracts that surround small, yellowish flowers. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
